snippet: The story of how a refugee came to trade his daughter to resolve a debt is in part a saga of terrible choices faced by some of the poorest Afghan families.
abstract: Taj Mohammad, refugee from fighting in Helmand Province, Afghanistan, must trade his 6-year-old daughter Naghma if he is unable to repay $2,500 he borrowed; story of Naghma, who will have to marry the lender's 17-year-old son, is in part a saga of terrible choices faced by some of the poorest Afghan families.
